Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery kantharos; interior glazed black with traces of narrow band in added red; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of warrior to right (chiton with added white, legs, greaves with added red, spear and black and red striped cloak remaining).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 42, pl. XXI, no. 28)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 356, no. B457)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1240) (phase 3)
